Event.name: Emergency_fire
Event.definition: <def-root>A fire which burns and requires an emergency-type response.</def-root>

Arg.name: Fire
Arg.definition: <def-root>The total material currently involved in combustion, including both the parts of the Fuel currently undergoing chemical alteration and the partially ionized gas that results from this process.</def-root>

Arg.name: Fuel
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that is undergoing rapid chemical alteration leading to damage or destruction.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the Emergency_fire event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (loudly, urgently), and general descriptions comparing events.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: wildland fire.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: Fire burning in rural, undeveloped area.

lexUnit.name: wildfire.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A fire in non-urban areas requiring emergency response.
